event_text: m_c is brought back to camp after wandering off.
m_c calls the younger cats to {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} den to tell stories of the Clan's past.
m_c speaks to r_c about how to better defend the camp.
m_c helps reinforce the dens in the camp while the rest of the camp is on patrol.
m_c places small feathers and shining stones near the nest of each Clanmate while they're on patrol.
m_c keeps an eye on the camp while the warriors are on patrol.
m_c disappears for a few days, then returns to camp with a acc_singular around {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} neck.
m_c awakens with multiple objects stacked on {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, and the sound of giggling cats in the distance.
m_c calls out to some eager kits, and after they have situated themselves in front of m_c, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/start/starts} telling the kits a thrilling story of times long past.
m_c finds acc_plural while out on a walk and decides to keep them.
r_c finds acc_plural while out on a walk and decides to give them to m_c.

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a pretty flower! m_c takes it and decorates {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with it, purring out a thank you.

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a pretty acc_singular! m_c takes it and decorates {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with it, purring out a thank you.

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a pretty acc_singular! m_c takes it and decorates {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with it, purring out a thank you.

r_c finds a pretty, smelly field of onions with pretty pink blooms. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/take/takes} a few, and {VERB/r_c/gift/gifts} the stalks to m_c! m_c wears them all with a big sunny smile.

r_c finds a patch of odd red orchids. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/decide/decides} to take a pair of it's prettiest blooms for a gift to give to m_c! m_c decorates {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with the pretty flowers, cooing softly at how pretty {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} feel with them on.
m_c finds acc_singular! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wear/wears} the blooms with a smile.
r_c gifted m_c bunches of pretty purple flowers! m_c wears them all with a big sunny smile.
m_c finds a cool stick near the edge of camp! m_c decides it's cool enough to keep around.
Mysteriously, it seems like m_c has found a small pumpkin near camp. m_c decides to roll it around along with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} around camp.

r_c finds a weird little pumpkin while on patrol! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} it back home to m_c, and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} it's a gift! m_c accepts it happily, and decides to roll it around.
After a warm stroll in the leaf-broken sunlight, m_c comes back with moss in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} jaws. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} seem oddly possessive over it.
m_c meows softly, volunteering to go on a moss-gathering patrol with r_c. They have a nice time talking while walking to a moss patch, and m_c comes home with fresh moss in their jaws.
m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head at the camp wall. Nobody's entirely sure why... until {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/pluck/plucks} a few ivy leaves off of the wall, and wear it with pride.

r_c finds a cool ivy-covered tree while on patrol! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} a pair of pretty leaves back home to m_c, and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} it's a gift! m_c accepts it happily, and decides to wear it.
m_c spots an oak tree dropping acorns, and decided to take and wear one.
After m_c gets bonked on the head by a towering oak tree's falling acorns, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} decide to take and wear one out of pure spite.
m_c trudges around camp with {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt somehow covered in muddy grime and moss. After being properly cleaned, m_c decides to keep the moss.
r_c, while m_c dozes off in camp, proceeds to pelt m_c with moss! m_c wakes up and snaps at r_c, but... keeps the moss on anyway. Strange.

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers to show {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a cool, silly little snake {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} found! m_c takes {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} invitation. After seeing the weird, harmless thing, m_c decides to take it home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c gently guides a acc_singular into camp. Seems like m_c has found a new friend?
m_c sneaks out of camp to go bird watching. Seems like one of the birds decided to stick around m_c after {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} attempt to leave!
m_c and r_c sneak out of camp to go bird watching. Seems like one of the birds decided to stick around m_c after {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} attempt to leave!
r_c mrrps at m_c, asking {PRONOUN/m_c/object} if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} wanted acc_plural that they found. m_c says yes, and thanks {PRONOUN/r_c/object} for the cool wings!
m_c comes into camp with a happy glint in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eye, happily sharing how m_c managed to keep a snail as {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pet.
m_c seems to have found a strange bug, and has decided to keep it as a pet.
r_c seems to have found a strange bug, and calls m_c over to see it. Curiously enough, m_c has decided to keep it as a pet.
m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head idly at a bee flying around {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head. It doesn't seem to want to sting {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, so m_c assumes it wants to be {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} friend!
m_c wanders out on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} own on a odd day, and comes back with a bee! m_c claims it's {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new pet.
m_c wanders out on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} own on a odd day, and comes back with a fruity smelling acc_singular! m_c flaunts their new acc_singular with grace.

m_c proudly shows off something that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} been working on for the past few days -- a perfectly crafted acc_singular! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/decide/decides} to wear it, and {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} do so proudly.

r_c proudly shows off something that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} been working on for the past few days -- a perfectly crafted acc_singular, made as a gift for m_c! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/decide/decides} to wear it, purring softly.

m_c proudly shows off something that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} been working on for the past new days -- a clean, pristine white bird skull. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} decide to wear it, and {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} do so proudly.

r_c proudly shows off something that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} been working on for the past few days -- a clean, pristine white bird skull. m_c wears it with a purr, thanking them for the cool trinket.

Over the past few days, m_c has been adamant on being near a nearby daisy patch. On an early morning, m_c reveals that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} been braiding a daisy corsage for {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} tail! m_c flaunts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} work proudly.
m_c received a present, gently weaved acc_plural, from r_c and decided to keep it with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
